cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MA 

Reasoning: The paper discusses the problem of making sequential decisions in unknown probabilistic environments, which is a common topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper also discusses reinforcement learning and Bayesian approaches, which are commonly studied in the subfields of machine learning and artificial intelligence. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also discusses Markov decision processes, which are commonly studied in the subfield of control systems, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses optimization and decision-making, which are commonly studied in the subfield of mathematical optimization, making cs.MA (Mathematical Optimization) a possible sub-category as well.
